5.title: What are oil sands?
5.text:
What are Oil Sands?

Oil sands are a mixture of sand, water, clay and bitumen. Bitumen is oil that is too heavy or thick to flow or be pumped without being diluted or heated.

www.oilsandstoday.ca

Facts on Oil Sands

A pocket book designed to give you fast, easy access to oil sands facts that will help you get in on the discussion.

www.capp.ca

Come See For Yourself (VIDEO)

Learn what the oil sands are and how they're developed as well as whats being done to protect the environment, pioneer technology, reclaim land, engage communities, and provide economic opportunities.

www.youtube.com

Recovering the oil

Oil sands are recovered using two main methods: open-pit mining and in situ drilling. The method depends on how deep the reserves are deposited.

www.oilsandstoday.ca

The History of Canada's Oil Sands

Canada's oil sands have drawn interest for more than 200 years. Historical documents date back as far as 1715, when James Knight, Factor of Fort York, wrote in his journal about "gum or pitch that flows out of the banks of a river" (the Athabasca).

www.oilsandstoday.ca

Presented by:

68.title: Resource Centre
68.text:
Energy sector game changers

Watch now: developments, risks, and trends analysis from experts on the global energy outlook.

 

What Alberta's Climate Leadership Policy means for the energy sector

Experts break down the potential impacts of Alberta’s sweeping new approach to greenhouse gas policy.

 

Global regulatory trends to watch in 2016

As government priorities change, and business models and technology evolve, businesses need to look ahead to the regulatory landscape that will govern their conduct over the next year. In this report, experts weigh in on regulatory trends to watch in 2016.

 

The Canadian Retail Report: Winter 2016

Practical content to keep you current on the developments that affect retailers in Canada.

 

Trans-Pacific Partnership: what you need to know

Experts provide an insightful overview of one of the largest and most ambitious free trade initiatives in history.

 

US Policy Scan for 2016

Outlook and analysis you can use for the year ahead, as the US enters the 2016 presidential election year.

 

Provided by

1.name: Lookahead
1.description: A notable event we'll probably cover. Once it's assigned, switch Status to Assigned

2.name: Assigned
2.description: Once you've started working on this post, move Status to Draft

4.name: Draft
4.description: This post is in progress. Next it goes to Ready to Edit

5.name: Ready to edit
5.description: It's ready for copy editing. Ask for revisions, or Publish/Update

6.name: Edited
6.description: For posts that are 100 per cent ready for publication, but held.
